result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M Pagel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Completion of Representation
Transcript of 6-20-17 Plea and Sentencing (Prison)
w/attachments

[NL] cases 15CF149, 15CM165, 17CF47, and 17CT169 called at 10:09 am 
Defendant James M Pagel in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr.Pagel, verifying that he understands and joins in the agreement. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "NO CONTEST" entered on 15CF149-Count# 1 and 17CF47-Counts #1 & 3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (DA Happ files victim impact statements and restitution requests), the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Pagel guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the state, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #15CF149- Counts #2 & 3, and 17CF47-Count #2, and Case #15CM165.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel.

As to Case 15CF149- Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Pagel to 5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH, consecutive to any other sentence in being.
The Court will await a stipulation from counsel regarding the days credit for time already served.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment, treatment and follow through 
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as may be required
--attempt to obtain/maintian employment and/or education program per Agent
--a undergo a sexual evaluation as required by the Departmen of Corrections and follow through with treatment
--no contact with ARK or RSK unless they and the Agent agree
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay subpoena fees of $180.50 related to this case, and to pay $86 in subpoena fees related to read-in case #15CM165
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, and as calculated by the clerk 
The Court requires Mr. Pagel to register as a Sex Offender. 
--------------------------------------------

As to 17CF47- Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Pagel to serve 9 months incarceration, to be served in the Wisconsin Prison System. This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH, concurrent.
The Court will await a stipulation from counsel regarding the days credit time already served. 
The Court orders payment of costs, fees, and surcharges; this amount is to be entered as a civil judgment.  
The Court orders entry of civil judgments for restitution: $1,000 in favor of James Sizer & Kim Sizer, and $2,518.21 in favor of Helenville Mutual Insurance Company.  

As to 17CF47- Count #3, the Court sentences Mr. Pagel to pay costs only; this amount is to be entered as a civil judgment.

In Case #17CF47 only the Court grants the Defendant's request for expungement of the case upon the completion of the sentences.  
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explaination of deteminate sentence form is given to Defendant
recess 10:45 am
Status conference on June 20, 2017 at 09:00 am.

[MK] cases #15CF149,#15CM165, #17CF47 called at 3:07pm. 
Defendant James M Pagel in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court clarifies that this Court/Judge Hue-Branch II is now assigned to these cases.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that a Pretrial was held; he proposes setting Case #15CF149 as the first case to be set for trial. Attorney De La Rosa states that he needs at least two months to prepare for trial.
Counsel agree that a two-day trial length is needed.  
recess 3:11pm.

[MK] cases #15CF149 and #15CM165 called at 3:26pm.
Defendant James M Pagel appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Pagel provides information on his current address:  502 S. Center Avenue, Jefferson WI 53549
Service of both Criminal Complaints admitted, readings waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
In Case #15CM165:  Pleas of "Not Guilty" entered' speedy trial is waived by the Defense.
In Case #15CF149:  Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a separate Bond in each case.  In each case the Bond is a $2,500  Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with A.R.K.,  R.S.K. or , A.P.
--no unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18
--no discussion of the facts of either case with Jeff Grosenick Jr.
